author: Anonymous Beaker
title: Cond. Expressions: Else
question:
So cond. expressions are formatted with several cases of [<question> <answer>].
1) Does the answer always have to be a value? Or is it ever allowed to type an expression instead? (like a boolean, or etc.)
2) Likewise, for the "else" case, does that answer always have to be a value?
student_answer:
In cond case, the answer could be a value (number, string) or a boolean as well depending upon the case.
In the example of GradeStanding the cond answer was a boolean.

(define (grades? x)
(cond [(number? x) (>= 90)]
[(string=? x "H") "H"]

For more details check @244.
instructor_answer: Also check out @285 - Very similar questions and the answer there can be extrapolated to non-boolean types.
